verses.verse: And <WG2532> it came to pass,<WG1096> as he<WG846> went<WG2064> into<WG1519> the house<WG3624> of one<WG5100> of the<WG3588> chief<WG758> Pharisees<WG5330> to eat<WG5315> bread<WG740> on the sabbath day,<WG4521> that<WG2532> they<WG846> watched<WG2258> <WG3906> him.<WG846>
And, <WG2532> behold,<WG2400> there was<WG2258> a certain<WG5100> man<WG444> before<WG1715> him<WG846> which had the dropsy.<WG5203>

And <WG2532> Jesus<WG2424> answering<WG611> spake<WG2036> unto<WG4314> the<WG3588> lawyers<WG3544> and<WG2532> Pharisees,<WG5330> saying,<WG3004> <WG1487> Is it lawful<WG1832> to heal<WG2323> on the<WG3588> sabbath day? <WG4521>
And <WG1161> they<WG3588> held their peace.<WG2270> And<WG2532> he took<WG1949> him, and healed<WG2390> him,<WG846> and<WG2532> let him go;<WG630>

And <WG2532> answered<WG611> them,<WG846> saying,<WG2036> Which <WG5101> of you<WG5216> shall have an ass<WG3688> or<WG2228> an ox<WG1016> fallen<WG1706> into<WG1519> a pit,<WG5421> and<WG2532> will not<WG3756> straightway<WG2112> pull him out <WG385> <WG846> on <WG1722> the<WG3588> sabbath<WG4521> day? <WG2250>
And <WG2532> they could<WG2480> not<WG3756> answer him again<WG470> <WG846> to<WG4314> these things.<WG5023>

And <WG1161> he put forth<WG3004> a parable<WG3850> to<WG4314> those which were bidden,<WG2564> when he marked<WG1907> how<WG4459> they chose out<WG1586> the<WG3588> chief rooms;<WG4411> saying<WG3004> unto<WG4314> them,<WG846>

When <WG3752> thou art bidden<WG2564> of<WG5259> any<WG5100> man to<WG1519> a wedding,<WG1062> sit not down <WG2625> <WG3361> in <WG1519> the<WG3588> highest room;<WG4411> lest<WG3379> a more honorable man<WG1784> than thou<WG4675> be<WG5600> bidden<WG2564> of<WG5259> him; <WG846>

And <WG2532> he that bade<WG2564> thee<WG4571> and<WG2532> him<WG846> come<WG2064> and say<WG2046> to thee,<WG4671> Give<WG1325> this man<WG5129> place;<WG5117> and<WG2532> thou<WG5119> begin<WG756> with<WG3326> shame<WG152> to take<WG2722> the<WG3588> lowest<WG2078> room. <WG5117>

But <WG235> when<WG3752> thou art bidden,<WG2564> go<WG4198> and sit down<WG377> in<WG1519> the<WG3588> lowest<WG2078> room;<WG5117> that<WG2443> when<WG3752> he bade<WG2564> thee<WG4571> cometh,<WG2064> he may say<WG2036> unto thee,<WG4671> Friend,<WG5384> go up<WG4320> higher: <WG511> then<WG5119> shalt thou<WG4671> have<WG2071> worship<WG1391> in the presence<WG1799> of them that sit at meat with<WG4873> thee. <WG4671>
For <WG3754> whosoever<WG3956> exalteth<WG5312> himself<WG1438> shall be abased;<WG5013> and<WG2532> he that humbleth<WG5013> himself<WG1438> shall be exalted. <WG5312>

Then <WG1161> said<WG3004> he also<WG2532> to him that bade<WG2564> him,<WG846> When <WG3752> thou makest<WG4160> a dinner<WG712> or<WG2228> a supper,<WG1173> call<WG5455> not<WG3361> thy<WG4675> friends,<WG5384> nor<WG3366> thy<WG4675> brethren,<WG80> neither<WG3366> thy<WG4675> kinsmen,<WG4773> nor<WG3366> thy rich<WG4145> neighbors;<WG1069> lest<WG3379> they<WG846> also<WG2532> bid thee again, <WG479> <WG4571> and <WG2532> a recompense<WG468> be made<WG1096> thee. <WG4671>
But <WG235> when<WG3752> thou makest<WG4160> a feast,<WG1403> call<WG2564> the poor,<WG4434> the maimed,<WG376> the lame,<WG5560> the blind: <WG5185>

And <WG2532> thou shalt be<WG2071> blessed;<WG3107> for<WG3754> they cannot <WG2192> <WG3756> recompense <WG467> thee: <WG4671> for<WG1063> thou<WG4671> shalt be recompensed<WG467> at<WG1722> the<WG3588> resurrection<WG386> of the<WG3588> just. <WG1342>

And <WG1161> when one<WG5100> of them that sat at meat with<WG4873> him heard<WG191> these things,<WG5023> he said<WG2036> unto him,<WG846> Blessed<WG3107> is he<WG3739> that shall eat<WG5315> bread<WG740> in<WG1722> the<WG3588> kingdom<WG932> of God.<WG2316>
Then <WG1161> said<WG2036> he<WG3588> unto him,<WG846> A certain<WG5100> man<WG444> made<WG4160> a great<WG3173> supper,<WG1173> and<WG2532> bade<WG2564> many: <WG4183>

And <WG2532> sent<WG649> his<WG848> servant<WG1401> at supper<WG1173> time<WG5610> to say<WG2036> to them that were bidden,<WG2564> Come;<WG2064> for<WG3754> all things<WG3956> are<WG2076> now<WG2235> ready. <WG2092>

And <WG2532> they all<WG3956> with<WG575> one<WG3391> consent began<WG756> to make excuse.<WG3868> The<WG3588> first<WG4413> said<WG2036> unto him,<WG846> I have bought<WG59> a piece of ground,<WG68> and<WG2532> I must<WG2192> needs<WG318> go<WG1831> and<WG2532> see<WG1492> it: <WG846> I pray<WG2065> thee<WG4571> have<WG2192> me<WG3165> excused. <WG3868>

And <WG2532> another<WG2087> said,<WG2036> I have bought<WG59> five<WG4002> yoke<WG2201> of oxen,<WG1016> and<WG2532> I go<WG4198> to prove<WG1381> them: <WG846> I pray<WG2065> thee<WG4571> have<WG2192> me<WG3165> excused. <WG3868>
And <WG2532> another<WG2087> said,<WG2036> I have married<WG1060> a wife,<WG1135> and<WG2532> therefore <WG1223> <WG5124> I cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> come. <WG2064>

So <WG2532> that<WG1565> servant<WG1401> came,<WG3854> and showed<WG518> his<WG848> lord<WG2962> these things.<WG5023> Then<WG5119> the<WG3588> master of the house<WG3617> being angry<WG3710> said<WG2036> to his<WG848> servant,<WG1401> Go out<WG1831> quickly<WG5030> into<WG1519> the<WG3588> streets<WG4113> and<WG2532> lanes<WG4505> of the<WG3588> city,<WG4172> and<WG2532> bring in<WG1521> hither<WG5602> the<WG3588> poor,<WG4434> and<WG2532> the maimed,<WG376> and<WG2532> the halt,<WG5560> and<WG2532> the blind. <WG5185>
And <WG2532> the<WG3588> servant<WG1401> said,<WG2036> Lord,<WG2962> it is done<WG1096> as<WG5613> thou hast commanded,<WG2004> and<WG2532> yet<WG2089> there is<WG2076> room. <WG5117>

And <WG2532> the<WG3588> lord<WG2962> said<WG2036> unto<WG4314> the<WG3588> servant,<WG1401> Go out<WG1831> into<WG1519> the<WG3588> highways<WG3598> and<WG2532> hedges,<WG5418> and<WG2532> compel<WG315> them to come in,<WG1525> that<WG2443> my<WG3450> house<WG3624> may be filled. <WG1072>
For <WG1063> I say<WG3004> unto you,<WG5213> That<WG3754> none<WG3762> of those<WG1565> men<WG435> which were bidden<WG2564> shall taste<WG1089> of my<WG3450> supper. <WG1173>
And <WG1161> there went great multitudes with<WG4848> <WG4183> <WG3793> him:<WG846> and<WG2532> he turned,<WG4762> and said<WG2036> unto<WG4314> them,<WG846>

If any<WG1536> man come<WG2064> to<WG4314> me,<WG3165> and<WG2532> hate<WG3404> not<WG3756> his<WG1438> father,<WG3962> and<WG2532> mother,<WG3384> and<WG2532> wife,<WG1135> and<WG2532> children,<WG5043> and<WG2532> brethren,<WG80> and<WG2532> sisters,<WG79> yea,<WG2089> and<WG1161> his own<WG1438> life<WG5590> also,<WG2532> he cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> be <WG1511> my<WG3450> disciple. <WG3101>

And <WG2532> whosoever<WG3748> doth not<WG3756> bear<WG941> his<WG848> cross,<WG4716> and<WG2532> come<WG2064> after<WG3694> me,<WG3450> cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> be <WG1511> my<WG3450> disciple. <WG3101>

For <WG1063> which<WG5101> of<WG1537> you,<WG5216> intending<WG2309> to build<WG3618> a tower,<WG4444> sitteth not down <WG2523> <WG3780> first, <WG4412> and counteth<WG5585> the<WG3588> cost,<WG1160> whether<WG1487> he have<WG2192> sufficient to finish <WG4314> <WG535> it?

Lest haply,<WG3379> after<WG2443> he<WG846> hath laid<WG5087> the foundation,<WG2310> and<WG2532> is not able <WG2480> <WG3361> to finish<WG1615> it, all<WG3956> that behold<WG2334> it begin<WG756> to mock<WG1702> him, <WG846>
Saying, <WG3004> This<WG3778> man<WG444> began<WG756> to build,<WG3618> and<WG2532> was not able <WG2480> <WG3756> to finish. <WG1615>

Or <WG2228> what<WG5101> king,<WG935> going<WG4198> to make war <WG4820> <WG1519> <WG4171> against another<WG2087> king,<WG935> sitteth not down <WG2523> <WG3780> first, <WG4412> and<WG2532> consulteth<WG1011> whether<WG1487> he be<WG2076> able<WG1415> with<WG1722> ten<WG1176> thousand<WG5505> to meet<WG528> him that cometh<WG2064> against<WG1909> him<WG846> with<WG3326> twenty<WG1501> thousand? <WG5505>
Or else,<WG1490> while the other<WG846> is<WG5607> yet<WG2089> a great way off,<WG4206> he sendeth<WG649> ambassadors,<WG4242> and desireth<WG2065> conditions<WG3588> of<WG4314> peace. <WG1515>

So <WG3767> likewise,<WG3779> whosoever<WG3956> he be of<WG1537> you<WG5216> that<WG3739> forsaketh<WG657> not<WG3756> all<WG3956> that he hath, <WG5224> <WG1438> he cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> be <WG1511> my<WG3450> disciple. <WG3101>
Salt <WG217> is good: <WG2570> but<WG1161> if<WG1437> the<WG3588> salt<WG217> have lost his savor,<WG3471> wherewith <WG1722> <WG5101> shall it be seasoned? <WG741>

It is<WG2076> neither<WG3777> fit<WG2111> for<WG1519> the land,<WG1093> nor yet<WG3777> for<WG1519> the dunghill;<WG2874> but men cast<WG906> it<WG846> out.<WG1854> He that hath<WG2192> ears<WG3775> to hear,<WG191> let him hear. <WG191>
